instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3024: What is 820-3024? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - chime loop, fan span, no picture,
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - chime loop, fan span, no picture,
threads.message: ok, inside the lvds connector is burnt. water sticker is still white, exterior of the connector looks good. fuse also looks good but its blown. i'll replace these and report back.,,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - chime loop, fan span, no picture,
threads.message:
ok board is now working,. was the damn connector.

ASD show 2 errors

CPU highside and Pbus. sensors failed...  same as the other board,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - chime loop, fan span, no picture,
threads.message:
this board was fixed by replacing the <TRANSISTOR>Q5300</TRANSISTOR>.


SOLVED!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - chime loop, fan span, no picture,
threads.message: Just to clarify.. fixing the display connector solved the chime loop issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - chime loop, fan span, no picture,
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2andrewd, post: 26072"]Just to clarify.. fixing the display connector solved the chime loop issue?[/QUOTE]


yeah, pins carry voltages was shorted to GND.
